oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Entry for Andrew Jackson's distilling operations in Federal distillery tax book, page 144
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: John Overton was the collector in Tennessee of the first Federal excise tax, the so-called Whiskey Tax. The entries from his ledgers list distillers in Tennessee by county. Included on this page is an entry for Andrew Jackson and his whisky operations at Hunter's Hill outside Nashville, his residence before purchasing the Hermitage property.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Overton, John, 1766-1833
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Whiskey Rebellion, Pa., 1794; Distilling industry--Tennessee--History
Distilling industry; Taxes
